result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul C. Anderson

records.addlTxt:
2:42 PM Defendant Paul C. Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hayes states DE thought all cases were taken care of.   Advised rights to an attorney. State requests $500 Cash.  Court states DE knew had notices of hearings.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. Court stops BBF and reinstates bond.  Court states $200.00 CASH bond to be posted for a total of $450.00
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order to show cause hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Paul C. Anderson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and orders cash bond forfeitures commence.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul C. Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Paul C. Anderson.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD appointment.  Court finds probable cause for these proceedings.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Atty Dolch advises the address on file is his current address.  State requests $500 cash bond on each case.  Atty Dolch requests $200 cash on each case.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
